New Records: USA made history by beating Pakistan in a T20 World Cup match
Key Match Events: The game went to a Super Over after both teams scored 159 in their 20 overs
USA made 18 for one in the Super Over, while Pakistan made 13 for one
Monank Patel's 38-ball 50 and Andries Gous' 35 off 26 deliveries helped USA reach 159 in their 20 overs
Pre-Game Insights: USA captain Monank Patel predicted that 160 was a chaseable target after USA bowlers kept Pakistan under 160
Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of creating partnerships with the bat
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel described the result as a 'big achievement' and praised the team's performance
Pakistan captain Babar Azam bemoaned his side's batting performance and acknowledged that USA performed better in all aspects of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win is a milestone moment for cricket in the United States, with USA hosting the ICC Men's T20 World Cup for the first time
The match was played at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas, one of the venues for the tournament
The USA's next match is against India on June 12 at the Nassau County Cricket Stadium in New York
